SENT.plain: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is a common chronic disease in the older population
Because of the cumulative effects of acid reflux over many years, older patients with GERD are at increased risk of complications such as esophagitis, peptic strictures, and Barrett's esophagus
Early endoscopy is indicated for all older patients with GERD, irrespective of their symptoms
Medical and surgical treatment options for GERD and its complications can provide excellent symptom relief and healing of esophagitis
Three management approaches--step up, step down, and the directed approach--are recognized guides to clinical decision-making
